byline.original: By MUJIB MASHAL and JAWAD SUKHANYAR

abstract: Afghan officials say thousands of troops have been dispatched to Kunduz Province to combat Taliban offensive against regional capital.
lead_paragraph: A battalion of the Afghan National Army was reportedly surrounded by insurgents, and the government stripped troops from other provinces to reinforce a vital northern trade hub.

headline.main: Afghan Troops Rush to Kunduz Amid Taliban Assault
headline.print_headline: Afghan Troops Rush to Kunduz as Taliban Flood In

snippet: A battalion of the Afghan National Army was reportedly surrounded by insurgents, and the government stripped troops from other provinces to reinforce a vital northern trade hub.
